required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Retrospective Evaluation of the Effect of Ultrasound-guided Obturator Nerve Block on Complications in Transurethral (TUR-M) Resection Surgery for Bladder Side Wall Tumors.
clinical_study.official_title: Retrospective Evaluation of the Effect of Ultrasound-guided Obturator Nerve Block on Complications in Transurethral (TUR-M) Resection Surgery for Bladder Side Wall Tumors.

lead_sponsor.agency: Erol Olcok Corum Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Erol Olcok Corum Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: In this study, the effectiveness of obturator nerve block added to spinal anesthesia in the operation of transurethral resection (TUR-M) of bladder lateral-infrolateral wall tumors on the obturator reflex and related complications was investigated.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of ultrasound-guided obturator nerve block on complications in transurethral resection of bladder cancer
primary_outcome.description: patient who underwent spinal anesthesia and obturator block

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of ultrasound-guided obturator nerve block on complications in transurethral resection of bladder cancer
secondary_outcome.description: The patient group who underwent spinal anesthesia and obturator block and the group without obturator block

clinical_study.condition: Efficacy of Peripheral Nerve Blocks on Complications, Morbidity and Mortality

study_pop.textblock: more than 18 years regional anesthesia method was applied The files of patients who underwent Tur-M surgery were reviewed retrospectively.

criteria.textblock:
retrospective study
Inclusion criteria:
- Patients over the age of 18 who have undergone bladder tumor surgery and whose anesthesia method is spinal anesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- under 18 years old , received general anesthesia pregnant and pediatric patient data not used

facility.name: Çorum training and research state hospital

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Erol Olcok Corum Training and Research Hospital
